posts.author: DMTaino
posts.content:
I play on Ravenloft "Prisoner of the Mist" on my spare time.

What would be the best class for a server where the max character level is 20th and multi-classing is upon request only. If asking for a 2nd class would need to have a description sent to DM. Also the magic/coins is low.. From what my 5th lvl Half-Orc has is a +1. Doubt their is anything higher but not 100% sure.

I'm not the best character builder; which is why I am asking the pros here. Any assistance and many thanks in advance!

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
"Best" is subjective. It could mean "the easiest to level", "the most interesting or fun", "the most dominant on the server", "the most popular" or have another meaning altogether depending on your personal goal and incentive.

You have begun to define the server orientation pretty well but much more is needed for an informed recommendation.
For instance...

Are you comfortable playing a spellcaster? Typically arcanists and clerics are the most dominant classes, especially within the constraint of 20 levels which pretty much rules out Weapon Masters (for example) who tend to need epic levels to develop their strengths adequately. Battle clerics normally rule the low-magic melee environment by their innate nature to overwhelm the low-magic conditions.

Then there are the polymorph classes like druid & shifter which excel in most low-magic realms. Their versatility can overcome many situations.

The key to helping you to determine the best "fit" for you rests primarily on your own play style and preferences. When you play any server for a period of time, usually you will notice a proliferation of a few classes and a paucity of others among the community. You can use the observed bias as a barometer for your own PC to a certain extent but it won't necessarily indicate what is the "best" for >> YOU

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Then, barring serious class or spell nerfs... Wiz 20 or Sorc 20 for PvP. Battle Cleric 20 for all else. All these classes can self-haste which is probably the greatest advantage in the game. In most situations, arcanists will rule divine casters with Time Stop, Bigby's & IGMS which is usually where the server design comes in to try to balance things out a bit for PvP.

TBH, though I have built for PvP, it requires an intimate knowledge of all the specifics of the server to be at all effective. Plus, any combat strategy that may be instinctive to use for one player may be inconvenient or downright unmanageable for another. So that means lots and lots of trial and error with different variants, each of which is designed specifically to counter the strengths of another player's toon.

There is no such build that is maximized for both PvM & PvP. Impossible. Vs. AI or vs. player control are vastly different build targets.

A half-orc makes a decent cleric but sucks in the arcane arts. Seems you want to ditch your outcast, though, so that may not be an issue. A high WIS hasted DP battle Cleric 16/Monk 4 would have the fastest and best attack progression if you can get it approved. BTW, you could design a build to dump to monk anywhere in the build as long as the approval process is completed by level 10 or so. It may not be as easy to level but will end up with the same potential. Just one example of building a toon while keeping your options open as you go.

Your Wisdom reaches 19 just in time to allow you to cast level 9 spells.
Power Attack will help you bash locked chests and doors, and is required for Cleave.
Cleave gives you an extra attack when you kill an enemy, which helps out early on when you only have 1 attack.
Magic domain gives you Mage Armor and Stone Skin, two buffs that should be handy in a low magic world.
Trickery domain gives you the very valuable Improved Invisibility spell.
In my opinion the morning star is the best choice of the few weapons that a Cleric has available without cross-classing as a Fighter or spending a feat on Martial or Exotic weapon prowess.
Extend Spell will help your buffs last longer, which is handy early on when they expire so quickly.
Blind Fight will help you against stealthy or invisible enemies.
Improved Critical will make your weapon a little bit more effective.
Empower Spell will let you make your buffs do up to 1.5 times as much for you.
Great Cleave will give additional attacks when you are surrounded by enemies that you can kill in 1 attack.

Now, we go on to the skills:
Concentration will help you cast spells in combat.
Heal will let you heal more health with a healing kit.
Lore will let you identify items without having to spend money at a vendor.
Spellcraft will give you a bonus to saves against spells.
Tumble will give you some extra Armor Class.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
@the OP: Now that you've settled on an actual build request, i.e. Battle cleric 20, you would be better served to post the request in the appropriate forum dedicated to that purpose. (Unfortunately, I do not have admin privileges or I would move it there myself.)

Until then, I recommend HIGHLY pumping WIS (mucho slots & DC) and exploiting Divine Power. Dagger is the probably the best critting simple weapon available (yes... elemental, divine & magic damage will crit). In a low-magic environment Trickery & Travel domains are the best bang for your divine buck.

BTW, check to see if Ravenloft provides standard crafting materials. If so, consider the Craft Wand feat to make the severely-exploitive HoG wands. In any case, compile all the cleric-specific (class and spell) server tweaks before you repost rather than dribbling in information we may need to help better, please.
